title: Pay-dirt

properties.name: description
properties.value: Pay-dirt is obtained whilst mining ore veins within the Motherlode Mine. Mining pay-dirt grants 60 (up to 61.5 with full prospector outfit) Mining experience and requires a minimum Mining level of 30. Pay-dirt can be cleaned by depositing them into the hopper in the centre of the mine. Once cleaned players must search a sack to claim their ores, which is dependent on the player's Mining level. Pay-dirt cannot be deposited in the bank.

Pay-dirt
Released24 April 2014 (Update)

Item ID12011

Pay-dirt is obtained whilst mining ore veins within the Motherlode Mine. Mining pay-dirt grants 60 (up to 61.5 with full prospector outfit) Mining experience and requires a minimum Mining level of 30. Pay-dirt can be cleaned by depositing them into the hopper in the centre of the mine. Once cleaned players must search a sack to claim their ores, which is dependent on the player's Mining level. Pay-dirt cannot be deposited in the bank.

Players have a 7/255 (2.74%) chance of obtaining a golden nugget per pay-dirt[1], which can be used to purchase the prospector outfit and other mining-related rewards from Prospector Percy's Nugget Shop.

What the pay-dirt becomes is determined at the time it is mined. If using a temporary boost, to try to get ore above your level, use the boost while mining, as opposed to using the boost at the hopper and sack.

Level required 30
Mining XP60 xp
RockOre vein
Required toolPickaxe
Respawn time1 minute

Cleaning[edit | edit source]

To clean the pay-dirt, deposit it into the hopper attached to the water circuit. When deposited, the pay-dirt will flow towards the sack at the other end. The sack can be searched to collect various ores and golden nuggets.

If a player logs out, or leaves the mine, while they have ores waiting to be collected, they will be there when they return.

Receiving each type of ore has a mining level requirement equal to the requirement for mining that tier of rock. Higher tier ores will also provide higher amounts of bonus experience when the pay-dirt reaches the sack.

Ore Level
required 		Bonus
experience 		GE Price
Coal 30 0 162
Golden nugget 30 0 Untradable
Gold ore 40 15 300
Mithril ore 55 30 125
Adamantite ore 70 45 1,100
Runite ore 85 75 11,019

Bonus experience is awarded when the deposited pay-dirt reaches the sack, not when the pay-dirt is deposited into the hopper or when the ores are drawn from the sack.

Average experience per pay dirt is 61.5 with at least level 85 Mining with the entire Prospector kit equipped. Using the ores in Smithing averages 51.125 experience per ore. If all the ores are collected from 85 to 99 Mining at Motherlode Mine, it will average out to 6,344,981 Smithing experience.

Ore rates[edit | edit source]

The ore received from pay-dirt is based on the player's Mining level, with better ores becoming more common at higher levels.

Ores are determined when the pay-dirt is mined, not when cleaning.[2] Higher level ore can be obtained by using a mining boost such as a dwarven stout or the dragon pickaxe's special attack while mining. This might be important for Ironmen who would like a low effort way to obtain ores above their mining levels.

.283833681314718,"x":94},{"y":0.2756647976420936,"x":95},{"y":0.2674444613076048,"x":96},{"y":0.26063154550502077,"x":97},{"y":0.25463602498712135,"x":98},{"y":0.24604773898317944,"x":99}],"fill":false,"hoverBackgroundColor":"rgba(0,66,39,0.5)","backgroundColor":"rgba(0,69,41,0.3)","borderDash":[],"borderColor":"rgba(0,69,41,1)","hoverBorderColor":"rgba(0,66,39,1)","borderCapStyle":"round","clip":5,"baseColor":"#000000"},{"hoverBorderColor":"rgba(254,222,125,1)","showLine":true,"data":[],"borderColor":"rgba(254,227,145,1)","backgroundColor":"rgba(254,227,145,0.3)","hoverBackgroundColor":"rgba(254,222,125,0.5)","clip":5,"fill":false}]}}

Strangely, due to the rounding behavior of the game engine there are some levels where the golden nugget yield is slightly higher.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
Date unknown

The Medium Falador Diary and Hard Falador Diary no longer provide any increased chance of receiving higher ores when cleaning pay dirt.[3]

18 June 2015
(update | poll)

The slight increased chance at receiving higher ores when cleaning pay-dirt if you have completed the Falador Hard Diary and a further increased chance if you have completed the Falador Elite Diary is now correctly applied.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Upon death in 20+ wilderness, one pay-dirt is converted to two coins.
  • While the pay-dirt is getting cleaned, its examine changes to It's getting cleaned in the channel of water.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 8 June 2015. (Archived from the original on 29 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "Sorry, I just rechecked. It's actually a flat rate of 2.74% at all levels for a paydirt to become a gold nugget."
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 8 June 2015. (Archived from the original on 1 December 2019.) Mod Ash: "When it is mined. It'd stay as runite even if your level drops before you clean it."
  3. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 15 March 2020. (Archived from the original on 15 March 2020.) Mod Ash: "There's just one buff to pay-dirt, and it's for the elite diary only. This matches what the diary master says if asked."

rawContent:
{{Infobox Item |name = Pay-dirt |image = [[File:Pay-dirt.png]] |release = [[24 April]] [[2014]] |update = The Motherlode Mine! |members = Yes |quest = No |tradeable = No |bankable = No |placeholder = No |equipable = No |stackable = No |noteable = No |destroy = Drop |examine = Prospector Percy has a machine that can wash this. |value = 20 |weight = 1.814 |id = 12011 }} [[File:Pay-dirt detail.png|left|130px]] '''Pay-dirt''' is obtained whilst mining ore veins within the [[Motherlode Mine]]. Mining pay-dirt grants 60 (up to 61.5 with full [[prospector outfit]]) [[Mining]] experience and requires a minimum Mining level of 30. Pay-dirt can be cleaned by depositing them into the [[hopper (Motherlode Mine)|hopper]] in the centre of the mine. Once cleaned players must search a [[Sack (Motherlode Mine)|sack]] to claim their ores, which is dependent on the player's Mining level. Pay-dirt cannot be deposited in the bank. Players have a 7/255 (2.74%) chance of obtaining a [[golden nugget]] per pay-dirt{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/608325164334465024|date=8 June 2015|archiveurl=https://archive.is/6MxfN|archivedate=29 May 2020|quote=Sorry, I just rechecked. It's actually a flat rate of 2.74% at all levels for a paydirt to become a gold nugget.}}, which can be used to purchase the [[prospector outfit]] and other mining-related rewards from [[Prospector Percy's Nugget Shop]]. What the pay-dirt becomes is determined at the time it is mined. If using a temporary boost, to try to get ore above your level, use the boost while mining, as opposed to using the boost at the hopper and sack. ==Mining info== {{Mining info |name = Ore vein |level = 30 |xp = 60 |rock = [[Ore vein]] |tool = [[Pickaxe]] |time = 1 minute }} ===Mining chance=== {{Skilling success chart|label=Pay-dirt mining chance|xlabel=Mining level|showbefore=no |label1=Pay-dirt|low1=60|high1=105|req1=30|color1=brown|image1=Pay-dirt.png }} ==Cleaning== To clean the [[pay-dirt]], deposit it into the hopper attached to the water circuit. When deposited, the pay-dirt will flow towards the [[Sack (Motherlode Mine)|sack]] at the other end. The sack can be searched to collect various ores and [[golden nugget]]s. If a player logs out, or leaves the mine, while they have ores waiting to be collected, they will be there when they return. Receiving each type of ore has a mining level requirement equal to the requirement for mining that tier of rock. Higher tier ores will also provide higher amounts of bonus experience when the pay-dirt reaches the sack. {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="2" | Ore ! {{SCP|Mining}} Level
required ! Bonus
experience ! [[Grand Exchange|GE]] Price |- | {{plinkt|Coal}} | 30 | 0 | {{Coins|{{GEP|Coal|1}}}} |- | {{plinkt|Golden nugget}} | 30 | 0 | {{NA|Untradable}} |- | {{plinkt|Gold ore}} | 40 | 15 | {{Coins|{{GEP|Gold ore|1}}}} |- | {{plinkt|Mithril ore}} | 55 | 30 | {{Coins|{{GEP|Mithril ore|1}}}} |- | {{plinkt|Adamantite ore}} | 70 | 45 | {{Coins|{{GEP|Adamantite ore|1}}}} |- | {{plinkt|Runite ore}} | 85 | 75 | {{Coins|{{GEP|Runite ore|1}}}} |} Bonus experience is awarded when the deposited pay-dirt reaches the sack, not when the pay-dirt is deposited into the hopper or when the ores are drawn from the sack. Average experience per pay dirt is 61.5 with at least level 85 Mining with the entire [[Prospector kit]] equipped. Using the ores in Smithing averages 51.125 experience per ore. If all the ores are collected from 85 to 99 Mining at Motherlode Mine, it will average out to 6,344,981 Smithing experience. ===Ore rates=== The ore received from pay-dirt is based on the player's Mining level, with better ores becoming more common at higher levels. Ores are determined when the pay-dirt is mined, not when cleaning.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/608021782449119232|date=8 June 2015|archiveurl=https://archive.is/xlN6Z|archivedate=1 December 2019|quote=When it is mined. It'd stay as runite even if your level drops before you clean it.}} Higher level ore can be obtained by using a mining boost such as a [[dwarven stout]] or the [[dragon pickaxe]]'s [[special attack]] while mining. This might be important for [[Ironmen]] who would like a low effort way to obtain ores above their mining levels. {{Skilling success chart|label=Motherlode Mine ore chance|xlabel=Mining level|cascade=yes|showbefore=no |label1=Golden nugget|low1=7|high1=7|req1=30|color1=gold|image1=Golden nugget.png |label2=Runite ore|low2=-20|high2=5|req2=85|color2=#6f97ad|image2=Runite ore.png |label3=Adamantite ore|low3=-90|high3=50|req3=70|color3=#76a86f|image3=Adamantite ore.png |label4=Mithril ore|low4=-19|high4=90|req4=55|color4=#4d52a1|image4=Mithril ore.png |label5=Gold ore|low5=-40|high5=126|req5=40|color5=#9e7f4d|image5=Gold ore.png |label6=Coal|low6=226|high6=325|req6=30|image6=Coal.png|color6=#000000 }}{{^|Coal is actually a 100% drop if you fail all other rolls. However, the chart doesn't support this, and a low/high of 226/325 closely approximates this}} Strangely, due to the [[Skilling success rate|rounding behavior]] of the game engine there are some levels where the golden nugget yield is slightly higher. ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = |change = The Medium Falador Diary and Hard Falador Diary no longer provide any increased chance of receiving higher ores when cleaning pay dirt.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1239199151243644928|date=15 March 2020|archiveurl=https://archive.vn/cXsYP|archivedate=15 March 2020|quote=There's just one buff to pay-dirt, and it's for the elite diary only. This matches what the diary master says if asked.|name=Falador Diary reward tweet}} }} {{Subject changes |date = 18 June 2015 |update = Multiple Clues & Midsummer |poll = Old School Achievement Diary Rewards Poll |change = The slight increased chance at receiving higher ores when cleaning pay-dirt if you have completed the [[Falador Hard Diary]] and a further increased chance if you have completed the [[Falador Elite Diary]] is now correctly applied. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ==Trivia== *Upon death in 20+ wilderness, one pay-dirt is converted to two coins. *While the pay-dirt is getting cleaned, its examine changes to ''It's getting cleaned in the channel of water.'' ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Mining}} {{Motherlode Mine}} [[Category:Needs skilling success chart]]
